{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3373795,"name":"Chase Vendrillo","username":"Chase1699","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chase1699/{size}/230099_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-25T21:26:05.319Z","cooked":"

Hello!! For those who have worked with different swerve modules I am wondering which is you favorite and why? Pros and cons lists would be great to have. This year we ran L2 Mk4is with Neos. Next year the current plan is Mk4is again but L3’s with krakens. Our biggest limitation this year in terms of autos and cycling was primarily just max drive base speed and acceleration. Any recommendations or insights would be greatly appreciated!! Or we could just buy them all : ) (assuming we had thousands to spare)

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":34,"updated_at":"2024-04-25T21:26:05.319Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":724,"readers_count":723,"score":174.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":464550,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-favorite-kind-of-swerve","display_username":"Chase Vendrillo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58319,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1699 Captain"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-favorite-kind-of-swerve/464550/1","custom_user_title":"1699 Captain","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3373889,"name":"Adam","username":"Adam-z","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adam-z/{size}/223992_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-25T23:08:23.375Z","cooked":"

L3 with krakens is a great way to go. Just make sure you have high traction wheels to keep up with it.

We use Mk4i with krakens; gearing L3 with the 16 T pinion. And 3d printed wheels we replace 2-3 times at comp. Crazy speed and acceleration, but it’s current draw is a lot.

Do you think regular tread would even slip with the l4 upgrade?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":34,"updated_at":"2024-04-25T23:48:29.145Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":580,"readers_count":579,"score":116.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":464550,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-favorite-kind-of-swerve","display_username":"Adam","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":53083,"username":"leo-les","name":"Leo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/leo-les/{size}/172390_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65599,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-favorite-kind-of-swerve/464550/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3373958,"name":"MH","username":"AntPoison","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/antpoison/{size}/239474_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-25T23:50:04.102Z","cooked":"

L3 Mk4i with Krakens serves well.
I think def get 16t pinion kit w/ L3s, its just going to really help you with faster cycling. Im tempted to tell you Vortexes because of their strength, but depending on your driver speed cap, the Vortexes and Krakens may both reach it. The Krakens just happen to accelerate faster from my experiences.

However, on the Vortexes, trhe REV software kept ruining us personally because it kept reflashing and causing a slew of issues so we swapped to Krakens after our first attempts with vortexes. I’d say Krakens are safer than Vortexes, and I do remember a lot of the top teams like 254, 2056, 359, and 1690 used Krakens so it seems to be pretty popular. Would use them instead

So all in all, I’d say L3 16t pinion MK4i with krakens as you’re planning (presumably). It’ll serve you well. CTRE has a very good motor over there

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":34,"updated_at":"2024-04-25T23:50:04.102Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":566,"readers_count":565,"score":123.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":464550,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-favorite-kind-of-swerve","display_username":"MH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64932,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6995 CAD&Prog, Strat/Scout Lead"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-favorite-kind-of-swerve/464550/6","custom_user_title":"6995 CAD&Prog, Strat/Scout Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3373979,"name":"Eric1","username":"Eric1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eric1/{size}/192260_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T00:03:49.763Z","cooked":"

Hey,

My team used L3 MK4i’s with neos this year and next year we are thinking about moving to L3 w/ Krakens

We plotted out the key differences and they’re all (neo, vortex, kraken) pretty similar in speed, the only major difference (which is pretty major) is Kraken’s having almost double the torque. To my knowledge this makes the krakens accelerate slower but have more “strength,” which opposes what you’re stating. Please let me know if I am misunderstanding something

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":34,"updated_at":"2024-04-26T00:06:17.902Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":516,"readers_count":515,"score":108.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":464550,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-favorite-kind-of-swerve","display_username":"Eric1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64932,"username":"AntPoison","name":"MH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/antpoison/{size}/239474_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58672,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-favorite-kind-of-swerve/464550/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3374005,"name":"Jackson M","username":"Indoraptor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/indoraptor/{size}/221028_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T00:30:36.791Z","cooked":"

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":34,"updated_at":"2024-04-26T00:30:36.791Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":487,"readers_count":486,"score":127.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":464550,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-favorite-kind-of-swerve","display_username":"Jackson M","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62396,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-favorite-kind-of-swerve/464550/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3374047,"name":"","username":"Alex_Y","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T01:14:33.903Z","cooked":"
Eric1:

To my knowledge this makes the krakens accelerate slower but have more “strength,” which opposes what you’re stating. Please let me know if I am misunderstanding something

This is incorrect. Torque is directly proportional to acceleration when not traction limited which means that the krakens will accelerate much faster than the NEOs.

Chase1699:

This year we ran L2 Mk4is with Neos. Next year the current plan is Mk4is again but L3’s with krakens. Our biggest limitation this year in terms of autos and cycling was primarily just max drive base speed and acceleration.

You generally can’t have both without building super light. Your drive ratio is inherently a tradeoff between acceleration and free speed in which gearing to improve one hurts the other when not traction limited. If you are gonna buy new gears anyways, you can keep both the L2 and L3 ratio around (or the swap between 14t and 16t) pinions and make the swap depending on the game, picking L3 for full field sprints and picking L2 for shorter sprints.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":34,"updated_at":"2024-04-26T01:14:33.903Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":2,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":459,"readers_count":458,"score":156.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":464550,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-favorite-kind-of-swerve","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50219,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-favorite-kind-of-swerve/464550/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3374062,"name":"Sameer","username":"Elitelord","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/d26b3c/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T01:26:15.334Z","cooked":"

We ran L1 with Mk4 with neos which was horrendously slow so we’re planning to switch to either L3 + Kraken or L2 + Vortexes. We aren’t sure if Krakens are worth the cost though.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":34,"updated_at":"2024-04-26T01:26:15.334Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":408,"readers_count":407,"score":96.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":464550,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-favorite-kind-of-swerve","display_username":"Sameer","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66232,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5212 Programming lead"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-favorite-kind-of-swerve/464550/10","custom_user_title":"5212 Programming lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3374068,"name":"","username":"widekarl","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/widekarl/{size}/201391_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T01:32:35.143Z","cooked":"

Based on my team’s experience this season, I can tell you that L3 Mk4is with Krakens and the 16 tooth pinion kit are great! We had various electrical/power problems in many matches, but when our driver was able to push our bot to its limit, it went flying across the field.

We actually just ran Krakens as our drive motors and used NEOs for steering for budget reasons. I don’t know if that’s a consideration for you, but it’s definitely a viable option. The only downside for us was a little extra space on the belly pan taken up by the Spark MAX.

I will say I envied the MaxSwerve users when looking at some of the UTB intakes those teams could design, since those modules have such a small footprint.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":34,"updated_at":"2024-04-26T01:32:35.143Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":401,"readers_count":400,"score":100.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":464550,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-favorite-kind-of-swerve","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60691,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9038 Alum, Volunteer"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-favorite-kind-of-swerve/464550/11","custom_user_title":"9038 Alum, Volunteer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3374076,"name":"Eric1","username":"Eric1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eric1/{size}/192260_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T01:39:06.280Z","cooked":"

okay thank you

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":34,"updated_at":"2024-04-26T01:39:06.280Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":368,"readers_count":367,"score":73.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":464550,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-favorite-kind-of-swerve","display_username":"Eric1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":50219,"username":"Alex_Y","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58672,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-favorite-kind-of-swerve/464550/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3374079,"name":"Rahul Yarlagadda","username":"Knufire","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/knufire/{size}/67820_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T01:45:42.093Z","cooked":"

Just remember, the faster you gear, the more you are stressing the limits of how much current you can pull from the battery at once before browning out. I don’t think MK4i/Kraken L3 + 16T pinions on a max weight robot is a good/necessary choice for most teams.

Do you know what was causing the electrical/power problems? Is it easy to avoid?

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":34,"updated_at":"2024-04-26T03:06:34.652Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":15,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":332,"readers_count":331,"score":71.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":464550,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-favorite-kind-of-swerve","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":58672,"username":"Eric1","name":"Eric1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/eric1/{size}/192260_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58068,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"rapid react's #1 fan"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-favorite-kind-of-swerve/464550/16","custom_user_title":"rapid react's #1 fan","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3374102,"name":"Owen Shaule","username":"Ow1e5","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ow1e5/{size}/252780_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-26T02:14:24.676Z","cooked":"

We ran SDS Mk4 L4 with Krakens with great success with a robot on the lighter size, but if we had the chance we would of switched to L3 (or a L3 with a modified ratio) for greater acceleration because collisions were prevalent this year. Also make sure to get your hands on TPU or some other kind of high traction tread, it makes a big difference.

Also remember to lower your stator (slip) current limits in code, even at 60a we were pulling way too much current. One match we had it disabled and the robot pulled 400 amps

It depends on the game. Games with longer sprint distances will favor lower ratios because you have time to reach your free speed while games with shorter sprint distanced will prefer higher ratios with more acceleration. But generally, if there is anything in the way including the field, alliance partners, or opponents, you typically want as much acceleration as you can get as you spend a lot of time at low and mid-speed acceleration rather than at your free speed in most games.

If you aren’t sure, I would suggest getting l2 if money is tight because l2 is never the wrong ratio as you can generally get maximum acceleration while not being (significantly) traction limited. For games like 2022 or 2019 that have short sprints or lots of defense, l2 is optimal because acceleration matters a lot. For full field sprints, l3 or l2 with the 16t pinion will be slightly faster but I can’t imagine first encouraging more full-field sprints for a while due to the recent field damage.

flametek:

edit: I think in the 254 btb they used L3 but with a 13t pinion instead of the standard 14t, which makes like a L2.9

More like L2.1. Stock l2 is 6.75:1, l3 with 13t pinion is 6.59:1, stock l3 is 6.12:1 while l2 with a 16t pinion is 5.91:1.

Elitelord:

Do you know what was causing the electrical/power problems? Is it easy to avoid?

I’m not on our electrical subteam so I don’t have very detailed knowledge, but the main advice we got from Citrus Service was to make sure no wires could move around. We plan to focus more on that next season, but coming from an Everybot last year we didn’t think about wiring as much as we should have throughout the design phase, and it showed.

Our issues during matches were often CAN errors, but our pit crew got quite good at finding and fixing them. Our power problems at our first event were due to a malfunctioning PDH (according to the CSA), so we replaced that.

So yes, I think if you put some thought into electrical during the design (plan it out and make it accessible) and make sure everything is tightened down with strain relief, you should be able to avoid the issues we had. That’s our plan for next season, at least.
